Posts.Content: Thankyou both for your input. I'll keep you updated and really appreciate someone to talk to who's been through this!

Posts.Title: post radical prostectomy (2yrs4mo) PSA level 1.89 & concerned!

Posts.Content: Has anyone out there looked into alternative treatments or places in Mexico with herbs and or other concoctions? Any success with diet changes?
Posts.Title: post radical prostectomy (2yrs4mo) PSA level 1.89 & concerned!

Posts.Content: I'm writing this on behalf of my husband, he's at work. Here's the details, I apologize for not being familiar with the terms: Gleason score: 7 Primary pattern 4 Secondary pattern 3 Confined to the prostatic parenchyma tumor volume: 3cc, involving left and right lobes, apex and mid sections. Small foci in anterior sections. Margins: negative Lymph-vascular invasion: Not identified Pathologic stage: pT2c, pNO (AJCC 7th edition) Additional findings: Acute inflamation, High grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia (HGPIN) I'm waiting for the urologist's office to open. They're recommending we get a CT scan first of all to see if the CA has become metastatic. Help!! Any comments or suggestions would be very appreciated!
Posts.Title: post radical prostectomy (2yrs4mo) PSA level 1.89 & concerned!

Posts.Title: post radical prostectomy (2yrs4mo) PSA level 1.89 & concerned!

Posts.Content: My husband's surgery was 6/15/11. It was a DaVinci prostatectomy. His Gleason score was 4+3=7, and he's 57 yo. You said you think he'll be just fine. I'm assuming that a rise in his PSA from 0.03 last Feb 2013 to now a PSA of 1.89 in just 8 months is a good indication the cancer's back, if indeed it ever really went away. Any thoughts? ps. I forgot to tell you what his PSA was at the time of diagnosis: 5.89 Thanks!
